abstract: Militant assault on Pakistani transmission line plunges nation into blackout; power is partially restored in capital Islamabad and most populous city Karachi, but 80 percent of country remains without power.
lead_paragraph: Even with a partial restoration of power in the capital, Islamabad, and the most populous city, Karachi, 80 percent of the country remained without power after an apparent militant attack.

byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.

snippet: Even with a partial restoration of power in the capital, Islamabad, and the most populous city, Karachi, 80 percent of the country remained without power after an apparent militant attack.

headline.main: Rebels Tied to Blackout Across Most of Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Rebels Tied to Blackout Across Most of Pakistan
